newsitem.title: USA: Foundation says to buy Physicians.
newsitem.headline: Foundation says to buy Physicians.

text.p: Foundation Health Systems Inc said Thursday it has reached a definitive agreement to buy Physicians Health Services Inc for $29.25 per PHS sharein cash.
Foundation said the deal has a total consideration to Physicians share holders of about $280 million.
Foundation said it plans to finance the purchase with a combination of cash and bank debt.
The deal is expected to close by the end of 1997.
Foundation said it has entered into a voting agreement as part of the deal with the Greater Bridgeport Individual Practice Association Inc, which owns a majority of the voting power of Physicians.
Physicians Health Services is a 440,000-member health plan with operations in the New York metropolitan area. It recorded revenues of $482 million in 1996.
Foundations was formed by the April 1 merger involving Foundation Health Corp and Health Systems International Inc. It said its projected 1997 revenues are nearly $9 billion.
